result.execSummary:
All charges against Reginald T Allen in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reginald T Allen is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald T Allen

records.addlTxt: 11:46 AM Defendant Reginald T Allen not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. State moves to dismiss as the defendant is deceased. The Court will dismiss this matter.
Atty Tishberg appears on behalf of Defendant, Reginald Allen

Adjustment Number: 22A 031890,
Payable Number: 472349,
Receipt Number: 22R 034558,
Amount: $20.00

Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Reginald T Allen in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states they have retained attorney Mark Tishberg.  Court calls attorney Mark Tishberg by telephone on the record.  Attorney Tishberg requests an adjournment of the preliminary hearing stating he was uncertain of the status if he was retained or not as he had difficulties getting in contact with his client.  The defendant states they were intending to pay Attorney Tishberg today.  The Court will adjourn this for a preliminary hearing noting time limits previously waived.  State requests a status of counsel date the day prior as they did have an officer present today.  Court adjourns for preliminary hearing and status of counsel the day before.  If a notice of retainer comes in prior to the next date, the status of counsel date may be removed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:20 PM Defendant Reginald T Allen in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Initial appearance on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
09:33 AM Defendant Reginald T Allen not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on May 4th, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
